result.execSummary:
The defendant Neal A Hoffman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Fulltime employment, schooling, or combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week or if not the perform 10 hours community service per week.

Assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by th dept.
DNA sample
NO days jail credit.
Probation to beging immediately.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain GFE in FTE/schooling/combination of the two.  When not fully engaged, complete 9 hours community service.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. 

NO entering any bars, taverns, beer tents or liquor stores.
Any outstanding financial obligations to be paid through ES.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Discharged 07.11.2021
Sentencing Hearing on Revocation held 3-2-18

Clerk: Kimberly
Case called: 9:02am
State appears by ADA Chris Plaunt; Defendant appears in person with Atty Lou Ann Bohn.

Parties state joint sentencing recommendation
COURT ORDERS: Ct. 1 Misappropriate ID info - obtain money: 4 years WSPS- 2 years IC, 2 years ES. 231 days credit granted. Deft is eligible for both prison programming- Substance Abuse & Challenge Incarceration. CONDITIONS of ES: Complete any assessment, treatment, or counseling deemed necessary by agent. Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. No entering any bars, taverns, beer tents, or liquor stores. Maintain GFE in full time employment/schooling/combination of two, when not fully engaged complete 9 hours community service. If there are any financial obligations outstanding to be paid as condition of ES.

Writ of Habeas Corpus

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: probation revocation packet
Request/Agreement for Modification to Conditions of Probation As Alternative to Revocation to Probation - approved 8/17/15
and Demand for Discovery & Inspection
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Court reporter: Mary Burzynski by phone.
Case Called: 4:20 pm 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Def appears in person with Atty Julie Sawyer. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

PLEA: Ct. 1 (Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
B.N. makes statement. Atty Sawyer makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 30 months probation - CONDITIONS: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 10 hours community service per week; DNA sample; court costs. 
COURT finds the def is entitled to NO days jail credit. 
COURT directs def to report as soon as possible to probation and notes term of probation to begin immediately and run concurrent to any other sentence. 

Adj: 4:34 pm
Probable Cause Found
of Preliminary Examination
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 11, 2015 at 04:15 pm.

Clerk Marisa.

State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Deft appears in person with Atty Julie Sawyer. 
Waiver of Prelim. filed. 
Court questions deft as to waiver. 
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made. 
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial. 
Information filed. Reading Waived. 
Plea: Not Guilty. 
COURT advises parties to see JA to set plea hearing. 
Bond:  Continued.

Julie Sawyer

Deft states he is no longer employed. 
COURT continues indigency hearing to 4/9/2015 at 10:30 in Br. 4. 
COURT advises deft to be reevaluated by the public defender.

records.addlTxt: No contact with victim(s): B.N.
